intro: Marsypopetalum ceratosanthes, commonly known as the silky tamarind, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, silky-haired leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces elongated, woody pods that contain several seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
